summary:
Sanne van der Lugt is a senior policy advisor for the Volt members of the Dutch House of Representatives. Her main dossiers are European Affairs, Foreign Affairs and Defense. 

Before this position, she has worked as a researcher at Clingendael Institute and the LeidenAsiaCentre. Her research interests are Chinese economic activities in Africa, the digital silk road and China’s position in the fourth industrial revolution.

She has also worked as a research analyst at the Centre for Chinese Studies at Stellenbosch University in South Africa and led and conducted fieldwork in many African countries and regions in China. Some of her research has been commissioned by Oxfam, WWF and the European Commission. 

She has experience with running a business in China, and provided training and advice for European and Chinese companies and government organizations in dealing with respectively European and Chinese business cultures. 

Improving relations by increasing understanding is her motto and strength.

'Jacobs University Bremen', 'description': 'International Business theories put much weight on the China-Africa discourse; even though these theories are not always empirically verified. For example, potential explanations provided in a discussion section of the much quoted paper by Buckley et al. (2007) for why Chinese firms may not behave in the conventional manner regarding risk taking, are referred to as findings in later studies (Amighini et al. (2013); Buckley, Yu, Liu, Munjal and Tao (2016). This way the assumption of the uniqueness of the determinants of Chinese FDI is perpetuated without providing proof for it. The aim of my study is to empirically test the assumed competitive advantage for Chinese firms in relatively high risk host countries. 

My results show that contrary to popular believe, investments from both China and the U.S. are directed to countries with a low level of political stability and a high level of institutional maturity; rejecting the hypothesis that Chinese investors are attracted to high risk countries because of the relatively small regulative institutional distance', 'title': 'BIGSSS Ph.D. Fellow', 'employment_type': None}]}, {'company': {'id': None, 'name': 'Emerging Powers and Africa Network', 'logo': None, 'url': None, 'employees': {'start': None, 'end': None}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 11, 'day': None, 'year': 2012}, 'end': {'month': 12, 'day': None, 'year': 2014}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Nederland', 'date': {'start': {'month': 11, 'day': None, 'year': 2012}, 'end': {'month': 12, 'day': None, 'year': 2014}}, 'company': 'Emerging Powers and Africa Network', 'description': 'With the current trend towards a multi-polar and diverse world it is necessary to reflect on the changing position of Europe. As Europeans we need to reconsider many assumptions about our place in the world and therefore it is crucial to start focusing more on ‘listening to’ than on ‘explaining to’ Emerging Powers and Africa. This counts for academic researchers, NGOs, government institutions as well as private sector enterprises.

EPAN promotes ‘listening’ by bringing the perspectives of Emerging Powers and Africa into a more prominent position. EPAN organizes regular seminar sessions where prominent individuals from Emerging Powers or Africa present their perspectives on issues relating to national and international affairs. These highly interactive seminar sessions promote dialogue and exchange of ideas in the spirit of learning from other perspectives.', 'title': 'Co-founder', 'employment_type': None}]}, {'company': {'id': 1105180, 'name': 'Profundo', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C4E0BAQHrQIMKMuPoyQ/company-logo_400_400/0/1593182121142?e=1700697600&v=beta&t=JcJgAUXjOaTsjtZRR6tdvOeNgQ2OBAhqCUaHydlI_C4', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/profundo/', 'employees': {'start': 11, 'end': 50}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 10, 'day': None, 'year': 2012}, 'end': {'month': 10, 'day': None, 'year': 2013}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Amsterdam, Netherlands', 'date': {'start': {'month': 10, 'day': None, 'year': 2012}, 'end': {'month': 10, 'day': None, 'year': 2013}}, 'company': 'Profundo', 'description': 'Profundo is an economic research consultancy analysing commodity chains, financial institutions and Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR) issues.
